results.name: Matrix
results.overview: Matrix is the title of a Canadian-produced fantasy/adventure series that ran for 13 episodes during 1993 on the USA Network in the United States. The series later enjoyed a brief revival of interest due to a coincidence involving one of its stars.

results.title: Matrix
results.overview: Abstract art film made for gallery exhibition.

results.title: Matrix
results.overview: The film is composed of receding planes in a landscape: a back garden and the houses beyond. The wooden lattice fence, visible in the image, marks the border between enclosed and open, private and public space, and forms both a fulcrum for the work and a formal grid by which the shots are framed and organised.

results.title: Matrix
results.overview: "MATRIX is a flicker film which utilizes 81 still photographs of my wife's head. It is a film dependent upon variation of intense light changes by calculated combinations of black and white frame alternations with exposure changes. Throughout, the light intensity rises and falls as the head rotates in varying directions within a 360 degree frontal area." — James Cagle

results.name: Matrix
results.overview: Matrix was an Italian news program and talks show television, broadcast on Canale 5, from 2005 and 2012, and rerun on Mediaset Plus: it was a rival program of RAI flagship news program Porta a Porta.

results.title: Armitage: Dual Matrix
results.original_title: アミテージ・ザ・サード DUAL-MATRIX
results.overview: Naomi Armitage and Ross Sylibus have changed their names and live with their daughter Yoko as a happy and normal family on Mars — until an android riot breaks out at an anti-matter plant on Earth.

results.title: Armitage III: Poly Matrix
results.original_title: アミテージ・ザ・サード POLY-MATRIX
results.overview: Ross Sylibus is assigned to a police unit on a Martian colony, to find that women are being murdered by a psychotic named D'anclaude. He is assigned a very unorthodox partner named Naomi Armitage, who seems to have links to the victims. To stir things up more, every victim is found to be an illegally made third-generation android.

results.title: The Matrix
results.overview: Set in the 22nd century, The Matrix tells the story of a computer hacker who joins a group of underground insurgents fighting the vast and powerful computers who now rule the earth.

results.title: The Matrix: Generation
results.overview: After the 1999 premiere of the first Matrix movie, it became a pop culture phenomenon. A special documentary about the Matrix saga and its prophetic aspects.

known_for.title: I Can't Make You Love Me
known_for.original_title: I Can't Make You Love Me
known_for.overview: In a small bar illuminated by neon lights and pulsing with loud music, a queer guy, his face etched with melancholy, is lured to the dance floor by a daring stranger. They dance freely while drinking and share a moment of fondling, charged with sexual desires. Overcome by the thrill, the queer guy feels dizzy as everything starts to slow and blur.

known_for.title: Hot Dr Pepper
known_for.overview: A brief history on Hot Dr Pepper and a tutorial on how to make it

known_for.title: CIA Assassin: First Contract
known_for.overview: Paul Pounder (a.k.a. Agent 69) has seen better days. His age has caught up with him and he struggles to get work from the Agency. However, his string of bad luck is about to change. In the past three months, fifteen female C.I.A. agents have been found shot or dtabbed to death. Hidden video surveillance cameras captured Maizah Samar, an Arab who works for the Russians, in the act of fleeing the scenes at the same time as several agents had been killed.  C.I.A. Agen 0015 meets with Agent 69 to brief him on the murders. While thumbing through pictures of the dead women provided to him by 0015, Agent 69 discovers his fuck buddy, Agent 96, is one of the victims found shot to death. Looking at her bullet-riddled body, he recalls the wild sex and good times they had together. Shocked and grief stricken upon seeing the photos, Agent 69 is anxious to stop Maizah Samar. He accepts his First Contract, and so the story begins...
